clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic and Imaging Indicators of Immunocardiomyopathic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Multimodal Imaging Evaluation of Myocardial Involvement in Immunocardiomyopathic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Cardiac involvements in autoimmune diseases (AD) is common but underestimated and an early detection remains a clinical challenge for lacking of efficient imaging methods. The objective of the study was to investigate LV myocardial abnormalities in AD patients by multimodal cardiac imaging, including speckle-tracking echocardiology (STE), cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (CMRI) and positron emission tomography (PET).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in deformational parameters in echocardiography during follow-up period
primary_outcome.description: global longitudinal strain (%), circumferential strain (%) and radial strain (%) measured by STE in autoimmune diseases

primary_outcome.measure: Progression of myocardial fibrosis and edema during follow-up period
primary_outcome.description: Late Gadolinium Enhanced, T1 mapping and T2 mapping tested by CMRI

primary_outcome.measure: Change in myocardial perfusion during follow-up period

study_pop.textblock:
Patient is diagnosed with autoimmune diseases, including systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), vasculitis, dermatomyositis, sjogren's syndrome, scleroderma, rheumatoid arthritis and IgG4 associated disease.
Patient is capable of complying with study procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is diagnosed with autoimmune diseases, including systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), vasculitis, dermatomyositis, sjogren's syndrome, scleroderma, rheumatoid arthritis and IgG4 associated disease.
- Patient is capable of complying with study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is pregnant or nursing
- Patient is complicated with congenital heart disease
- Patient had cardiac surgery before
- Patient is complicated with serious infections
- Patient is complicated with organ failure
- Patient is complicated with tumors
- Patient is diagnosed indefinitely
- Patient has been involved in other clinical trial
